ygData.subject: RE: Newbie Questions
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yes, for the most part you anticipate when the next song will kick in and stop/start without watching for the message.  I suppose a musical background
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 9 Sep 1999, Woland Vildhufvud wrote:
>
> Unfortunately one of the above will often be true. For me going from two to
> three songs was just a matter of practice, but wour machine/connection may
> well set the limit lower. As for twisting 4 songs...John how do you do it???
> Most impressive! Do you stop the songs before the effect message shows? Ive

Yes, for the most part you anticipate when the next song will
kick in and stop/start without watching for the message. I
suppose a musical background helps, although I've managed to
do it watching for messages as well (sometimes being thrown
off by "begins to cast a spell" messages).

That said, I would swear Verant has slightly decreased the
duration of our songs, which may well have made weaving 4
impossible. Lately, I've been having more trouble than I
remember keeping just 3 songs up (and not due to missed notes
this time). I haven't tried 4 songs in a while, guess I'll
try it tonight.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
